page.title: 18THE FISHERIES LABORATORY
page.content: The Ministery of Agriculture and Fisheries' laboratory, in Kirkley, is the place where they study fish. Every day they measure fish and find out what sort of food they eat. They find out how many fish there are in the sea and where the best places to catch them are. They also find out how many fish are allowed to be caught every year. Every so often the people from the lab go on sea trips to find out other things about fish. Also at the lab they do research into fish farming including freshwater fish such as trout. They do this by breeding different sorts of fish, as well as lobsters, crabs and mussels.
